channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MiCEval: Unveiling Multimodal Chain of Thought's Quality via Image Description and Reasoning Steps
item.description: To address this gap, we propose Multimodal Chain-of-Thought Evaluation (MiCEval), a framework designed to assess the correctness of reasoning chains by evaluating the quality of both the description and each reasoning step.

item.title: Self-supervised contrastive learning performs non-linear system identification
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) approaches have brought tremendous success across many tasks and domains.

item.title: Optimal DLT-based Solutions for the Perspective-n-Point
item.description: We propose a modified normalized direct linear transform (DLT) algorithm for solving the perspective-n-point (PnP) problem with much better behavior than the conventional DLT.

item.title: MetaAlign: Align Large Language Models with Diverse Preferences during Inference Time
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) acquire extensive knowledge and remarkable abilities from extensive text corpora, making them powerful tools for various applications.

item.title: CoMAL: Collaborative Multi-Agent Large Language Models for Mixed-Autonomy Traffic
item.description: It utilizes a Perception Module to observe surrounding agents and a Memory Module to store strategies for each agent.

item.title: xPerT: Extended Persistence Transformer
item.description: However, due to its nature as a set, incorporating it as a feature into a machine learning framework is challenging.

item.title: Towards Robust Transcription: Exploring Noise Injection Strategies for Training Data Augmentation
item.description: Recent advancements in Automatic Piano Transcription (APT) have significantly improved system performance, but the impact of noisy environments on the system performance remains largely unexplored.

item.title: Multi-Source Spatial Knowledge Understanding for Immersive Visual Text-to-Speech
item.description: To address the issues, we propose a novel multi-source spatial knowledge understanding scheme for immersive VTTS, termed MS$^2$KU-VTTS.

item.title: ViConsFormer: Constituting Meaningful Phrases of Scene Texts using Transformer-based Method in Vietnamese Text-based Visual Question Answering
item.description: The main challenge of text-based VQA is exploiting the meaning and information from scene texts.

item.title: Distance between Relevant Information Pieces Causes Bias in Long-Context LLMs
item.description: These experiments reveal that while most current models are robust against the "lost in the middle" issue, there exist significant biases related to the spacing of relevant information pieces.

item.title: Efficient Annotator Reliability Assessment and Sample Weighting for Knowledge-Based Misinformation Detection on Social Media
item.description: The EffiARA annotation framework is introduced, aiming to utilise inter- and intra-annotator agreement to understand the reliability of each annotator and influence the training of large language models for classification based on annotator reliability.

item.title: Decomposing The Dark Matter of Sparse Autoencoders
item.description: Sparse autoencoders (SAEs) are a promising technique for decomposing language model activations into interpretable linear features.

item.title: SNAC: Multi-Scale Neural Audio Codec
item.description: Neural audio codecs have recently gained popularity because they can represent audio signals with high fidelity at very low bitrates, making it feasible to use language modeling approaches for audio generation and understanding.

item.title: Predicting time-varying flux and balance in metabolic systems using structured neural-ODE processes
item.description: We develop a novel data-driven framework as an alternative to dynamic flux balance analysis, bypassing the demand for deep domain knowledge and manual efforts to formulate the optimization problem.

item.title: FedMSE: Federated learning for IoT network intrusion detection
item.description: This approach enhances the performance of intrusion detection by effectively representing normal network data and accurately identifying anomalies in the decentralized strategy.

item.title: Teaching Models to Balance Resisting and Accepting Persuasion
item.description: PBT consistently improves resistance to misinformation and resilience to being challenged while also resulting in the best overall performance on holistic data containing both positive and negative persuasion.

item.title: Estimating the Causal Effects of T Cell Receptors
item.description: Here, we introduce a method to infer the causal effects of T cell receptor (TCR) sequences on patient outcomes using observational TCR repertoire sequencing data and clinical outcomes data.

item.title: BiGR: Harnessing Binary Latent Codes for Image Generation and Improved Visual Representation Capabilities
item.description: We introduce BiGR, a novel conditional image generation model using compact binary latent codes for generative training, focusing on enhancing both generation and representation capabilities.

item.title: Tell me what I need to know: Exploring LLM-based (Personalized) Abstractive Multi-Source Meeting Summarization
item.description: Previous attempts to address these issues by considering related supplementary resources (e. g., presentation slides) alongside transcripts are hindered by models' limited context sizes and handling the additional complexities of the multi-source tasks, such as identifying relevant information in additional files and seamlessly aligning it with the meeting content.

item.title: Osteoporosis screening: Leveraging EfficientNet with complete and cropped facial panoramic radiography imaging
item.description: EfficientNet B5, B6, and B7 models were trained to identify osteoporosis in both full PR images and cropped sections focusing on the mandibular cortical region.

item.title: Towards Effective Planning Strategies for Dynamic Opinion Networks
item.description: In this study, we investigate the under-explored intervention planning aimed at disseminating accurate information within dynamic opinion networks by leveraging learning strategies.

item.title: Benchmarking Deep Reinforcement Learning for Navigation in Denied Sensor Environments
item.description: We anticipate this benchmark of different DRL methods and the usage of adversarial training to be a starting point for the development of more elaborate navigation strategies that are capable of dealing with uncertain and denied sensor readings.

item.title: syren-new: Precise formulae for the linear and nonlinear matter power spectra with massive neutrinos and dynamical dark energy
item.description: We aim to construct accurate and interpretable symbolic approximations to the linear and nonlinear matter power spectra as a function of cosmological parameters in extended $\Lambda$CDM models which contain massive neutrinos and non-constant equations of state for dark energy.

item.title: REEF: Representation Encoding Fingerprints for Large Language Models
item.description: Therefore, model owners and third parties need to identify whether a suspect model is a subsequent development of the victim model.

item.title: Variable Aperture Bokeh Rendering via Customized Focal Plane Guidance
item.description: benchmark dataset and our constructed dataset VABD have demonstrated that the customized focal plane together aperture prompt can bootstrap model to simulate realistic bokeh effect.

item.title: Enhancing Large Language Models' Situated Faithfulness to External Contexts
item.description: SCR enables models to self-access the confidence of external information relative to their own internal knowledge to produce the most accurate answer.

item.title: ST-MoE-BERT: A Spatial-Temporal Mixture-of-Experts Framework for Long-Term Cross-City Mobility Prediction
item.description: Compared to existing methods, our approach frames the prediction task as a spatial-temporal classification problem.

item.title: Convergence of Manifold Filter-Combine Networks
item.description: In order to better understand manifold neural networks (MNNs), we introduce Manifold Filter-Combine Networks (MFCNs).

item.title: Towards Faithful Natural Language Explanations: A Study Using Activation Patching in Large Language Models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are capable of generating persuasive Natural Language Explanations (NLEs) to justify their answers.

item.title: ANT: Adaptive Noise Schedule for Time Series Diffusion Models
item.description: In this work, we propose Adaptive Noise schedule for Time series diffusion models (ANT), which automatically predetermines proper noise schedules for given TS datasets based on their statistics representing non-stationarity.

item.title: A Systematic Study of Cross-Layer KV Sharing for Efficient LLM Inference
item.description: Recently, sharing key-value (KV) cache across layers has been found effective in efficient inference of large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Almost-Linear RNNs Yield Highly Interpretable Symbolic Codes in Dynamical Systems Reconstruction
item.description: PWL models are popular in engineering and a frequent choice in mathematics for analyzing the topological properties of DS.

item.title: MomentumSMoE: Integrating Momentum into Sparse Mixture of Experts
item.description: Sparse Mixture of Experts (SMoE) has become the key to unlocking unparalleled scalability in deep learning.

item.title: Neural Real-Time Recalibration for Infrared Multi-Camera Systems
item.description: Unlike traditional calibration techniques that lack adaptability and struggle with on-the-fly recalibrations, we propose a neural network-based method capable of dynamic real-time calibration.

item.title: Less is More: Selective Reduction of CT Data for Self-Supervised Pre-Training of Deep Learning Models with Contrastive Learning Improves Downstream Classification Performance
item.description: The effect of these different reduction strategies on contrastive learning is evaluated on two pre-training datasets and several downstream classification tasks.

item.title: Attention-Guided Residual U-Net with SE Connection and ASPP for Watershed-Based Cell Segmentation in Microscopy Images
item.description: To address these issues, we propose a novel framework called RA-SE-ASPP-Net, which incorporates Residual Blocks, Attention Mechanism, Squeeze-and-Excitation connection, and Atrous Spatial Pyramid Pooling to achieve precise and robust cell segmentation.

item.title: G-NeuroDAVIS: A Neural Network model for generalized embedding, data visualization and sample generation
item.description: Motivated by this aspect, in this study, a novel generative model, called G-NeuroDAVIS, has been developed, which is capable of visualizing high-dimensional data through a generalized embedding, and thereby generating new samples.

item.title: Comparative Evaluation of Clustered Federated Learning Method
item.description: In this paper, we explore the performance of two state-of-theart CFL algorithms with respect to a proposed taxonomy of data heterogeneities in federated learning (FL).

item.title: Critical Questions Generation: Motivation and Challenges
item.description: The development of Large Language Models (LLMs) has brought impressive performances on mitigation strategies against misinformation, such as counterargument generation.

item.title: SurgeryV2: Bridging the Gap Between Model Merging and Multi-Task Learning with Deep Representation Surgery
item.description: However, in this paper, we examine the merged model's representation distribution and uncover a critical issue of "representation bias".

item.title: Unlearning Backdoor Attacks for LLMs with Weak-to-Strong Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Then, this teacher model guides the large-scale poisoned student model in unlearning the backdoor, leveraging PEFT.

item.title: AnomalyNCD: Towards Novel Anomaly Class Discovery in Industrial Scenarios
item.description: Compared with the current methods, AnomalyNCD combined with zero-shot anomaly detection method achieves a 10. 8% $F_1$ gain, 8. 8% NMI gain, and 9. 5% ARI gain on MVTec AD, 12. 8% $F_1$ gain, 5. 7% NMI gain, and 10. 8% ARI gain on MTD.

item.title: Shape Transformation Driven by Active Contour for Class-Imbalanced Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: The significant size differences among various organs in the human body lead to imbalanced class distribution, which is a major challenge in the real-world application of these SSL approaches.

item.title: Croc: Pretraining Large Multimodal Models with Cross-Modal Comprehension
item.description: Then, we conceptualize visual tokens as analogous to a "foreign language" for the LLMs and propose a mixed attention mechanism with bidirectional visual attention and unidirectional textual attention to comprehensively enhance the understanding of visual tokens.

item.title: Toward Generalizing Visual Brain Decoding to Unseen Subjects
item.description: This dataset allows us to investigate the brain decoding performance with the increase of participants.

item.title: Montessori-Instruct: Generate Influential Training Data Tailored for Student Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose Montessori-Instruct, a novel data synthesis framework that tailors the data synthesis ability of the teacher language model toward the student language model's learning process.

item.title: HiCo: Hierarchical Controllable Diffusion Model for Layout-to-image Generation
item.description: The task of layout-to-image generation involves synthesizing images based on the captions of objects and their spatial positions.

item.title: Supervised Kernel Thinning
item.description: In this work, we generalize the KT algorithm to speed up supervised learning problems involving kernel methods.

item.title: Artificial Kuramoto Oscillatory Neurons
item.description: It has long been known in both neuroscience and AI that ``binding'' between neurons leads to a form of competitive learning where representations are compressed in order to represent more abstract concepts in deeper layers of the network.

item.title: An Evolved Universal Transformer Memory
item.description: Prior methods propose to offset the escalating costs of modern foundation models by dropping specific parts of their contexts with hand-designed rules, while attempting to preserve their original performance.
